Blockchain technology can be used to create a secure and transparent ledger of property transactions, which can help to identify the users who post properties or participate in buy or sell transactions on the portal. The transactions can be recorded in blocks, which are linked and secured using cryptographic algorithms. Each block contains a unique code called a "hash" that is generated from the contents of the block, making it tamper-evident. This means that once a block is added to the chain, its contents cannot be altered without being detected.

To implement this in a real estate portal, a blockchain platform can be integrated with the portal's database to record transactions and secure user information. A unique identifier, such as a blockchain address, can be assigned to each user and linked to their transaction history on the portal. This will allow the portal to maintain a secure and transparent record of all transactions, making it easier to track users and prevent fraud.

In summary, blockchain technology can be used to enhance the security, transparency and trust in real estate transactions on a portal.
